https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@graph": [{"@type": "Article", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#article", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/"}, "author": {"name": "Sally McKenney", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/#/schema/person/3744271f85efc7e271411c4968f1c4ba"}, "headline": "Crispy Peanut Butter Cookies", "datePublished": "2014-08-03T22:46:05+00:00", "dateModified": "2022-03-03T23:25:36+00:00", "wordCount": 254, "publisher": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/#organization"}, "image": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#primaryimage"}, "thumbnailUrl": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Classic-Peanut-Butter-Cookies.jpg", "keywords": ["all-purpose flour", "brown sugar", "butter", "eggs", "granulated sugar", "peanut butter", "vanilla extract"], "articleSection": ["Cookies", "Desserts"], "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "WebPage", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/", "name": "Crispy Peanut Butter Cookies - Sally&#039;s Baking", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/#website"}, "primaryImageOfPage": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#primaryimage"}, "image": {"@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#primaryimage"}, "thumbnailUrl": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Classic-Peanut-Butter-Cookies.jpg", "datePublished": "2014-08-03T22:46:05+00:00", "dateModified": "2022-03-03T23:25:36+00:00", "description": "These crisp peanut butter cookies are old-fashioned style with crunchy, crumbly edges and soft-baked centers. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Crisp Peanut Butter Cookies", "description": "These classic peanut butter cookies are always a hit. Easy to make, easier to eat!\u00a0", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "peanut butter cookies, classic peanut butter cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Classic-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Classic-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Classic-Peanut-Butter-Cookies-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Classic-Peanut-Butter-Cookies.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature*", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "3/4 cup (150g) packed light brown sugar", "2 large eggs, room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 cup (250g) creamy peanut butter*", "3 cups (375g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "optional: 1/3 cup (67g) granulated sugar, for rolling"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter and both sugars together on medium speed until smooth.\u00a0Add the eggs and mix on high until combined, about 1 minute.\u00a0Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the vanilla and peanut butter and mix on high until combined. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, toss the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together. Add to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. Dough will be thick, yet very sticky.\u00a0Cover dough tightly and chill for at least 3 hours\u00a0(and up to 2 days) in the refrigerator.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll balls of dough (about 1.5 Tablespoons or 27-30g of dough per cookie) and roll into granulated sugar. Place 2 inches apart on the baking sheets. Press fork into the tops to create the criss-cross pattern. Bake for 12\u201313 minutes or until very lightly browned on the sides. The centers will look very soft and undone. Remove from the oven and let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. The cookies will continue to &#8220;set&#8221; on the baking sheet during this time.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/classic-peanut-butter-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}], "prepTime": "PT3H15M", "cookTime": "PT11M", "totalTime": "PT3H30M", "recipeYield": ["30", "30 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "23", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "William Duff"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-20", "reviewBody": "These cookies came out perfect using almond flour. Add the vanilla extract and beat just until incorporated.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/angel-food-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In several additions, slowly sift the flour mixture into the egg white mixture using a\u00a0fine-mesh strainer, gently folding after each addition. To avoid the cupcakes from deflating or tasting dense, don&#8217;t add the flour mixture all at once. Sift and very slowly fold in several additions. This is important! Spoon batter into liners,\u00a0filling only 2/3 full\u00a0to avoid spilling over the sides.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/angel-food-cupcakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cupcakes until very lightly browned around the edges and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 18-20 minutes. Covered in rich salted dark chocolate, each sweet buttery bite is filled with crunchy toasted almonds.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "dark chocolate almond toffee, homemade almond toffee", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/dark-chocolate-almond-toffee-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/dark-chocolate-almond-toffee-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/dark-chocolate-almond-toffee-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/dark-chocolate-almond-toffee.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups (340g; 12 ounces) whole unsalted almonds*", "1 cup (230g; 8 ounces) unsalted butter, cubed", "1/2 cup (120ml; 4 ounces) warm water", "1 cup (199g, 7 ounces) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon light corn syrup", "8 ounces (224g) dark chocolate, finely chopped*", "coarse sea salt or flaky sea salt, for sprinkling on top"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before you get started, review the information below the recipe card for helpful toffee troubleshooting tips.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 300\u00b0F (149\u00b0C) degrees. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. (Silicone baking mat is preferred.) Spread the almonds onto the sheet and bake for 15 minutes, stirring them around twice during that time. Toasting the almonds brings so much flavor to the toffee. Remove from the oven, allow to cool, and set 1 cup aside. Chop up the other cup of almonds nice and fine. Or pulse in a food processor a few times to break them up. These will go on top of the dark chocolate.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a 12&#215;17-inch jelly roll pan with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the cubed butter over medium heat in a 3-quart heavy duty saucepan. Stir occasionally (about every 2 minutes) with a wooden spoon as it melts. Once melted, add the water, sugar, salt, and corn syrup. Stir constantly until the sugar dissolves, then brush down the sides of the pan with a water-moistened pastry brush. Attach a candy thermometer to the pan. Do not let it touch the bottom of the pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once dissolved, stir occasionally as you bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, stop stirring. Rapid bubbles,\u00a0a thicker consistency, as well as a slightly darker color forms around 235\u00b0F (113\u00b0C). At the 265\u00b0F (129\u00b0C, hard ball stage) point, stir in\u00a0the 1 cup of toasted whole almonds. The mixture may separate when you add the nuts. If it does, temporarily remove the candy thermometer and stir vigorously until it all comes back together. Carefully reattach the thermometer and brush off any candy on the side of the pan with the pasty brush. Cook and stir the candy until it reaches 290\u00b0F (143\u00b0C, soft crack stage).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn off the stove, remove pan from the heat, and pour the toffee out onto the prepared jelly roll pan. Smooth into an even layer.\u00a0The toffee should be thick and not spread all the way to the edges of the jelly roll pan. Allow the toffee to\u00a0cool for 5 minutes.\u00a0Sprinkle half of the chopped chocolate on top. Allow the chocolate to soften and melt from the heat of the toffee, then spread the melted chocolate into a thin, even layer. Sprinkle half of the crushed almonds onto the wet chocolate and press down gently with the back of a spatula to adhere them. Refrigerate for 20 minutes to set the chocolate.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once set, flip the toffee over as a whole. You should be able to just peel it off the silicone baking mat. Melt the remaining chopped chocolate in the microwave, in 10 second spurts, stirring after each until completely smooth. Spread over the toffee and top with remaining chopped almonds, pressing down gently with the back of a spatula to adhere them. Sprinkle the top with sea salt. Refrigerate toffee again to set the chocolate, about 20 minutes. Once set, slice with a sharp knife or break into pieces\u2014as large or small as you want.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/toffee-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT40M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT2H", "recipeYield": ["1", "about 1 pound"], "recipeCategory": "Candy", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "8", "ratingValue": "4.1"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "3"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Emma Francis"}, "datePublished": "2023-10-25", "reviewBody": "I too struggled with the mixture splitting. If using boneless, skinless chicken tenders (chicken tenders are the lean strips of meat found attached to the underside of chicken breasts\u2014they can also be purchased separately), simply cut into 1-1.5 inch pieces.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pretzel-crusted-chicken-bites/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine flour, salt, and pepper in a shallow dish. Beat\u00a0eggs in another shallow dish. Pour pretzels\u00a0into a third shallow dish. Coat each chicken piece\u00a0in flour, shaking off any excess. Then, dip in egg and let any excess drip off. Then generously roll in the pretzels, shaking off any excess. Add more crushed pretzels to the dish if you are running low. Place the chicken bites on the prepared baking sheet. Lightly spray each with nonstick spray to &#8220;seal&#8221; the breading, which will prevent the breading from staying raw and allows it to bake onto the chicken fingers.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/pretzel-crusted-chicken-bites/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 8 minutes. Turn each piece over and continue baking until the outside is crisp and the centers are cooked through, about 6-8 minutes more. Baking times may vary, just make sure yours are cooked through. If you like them more brown, bake longer. Serve chicken bites with toothpicks (if using as an appetizer), honey mustard, or this spicy cheese sauce. Store any leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. I chopped them up and put on top of a salad. Her kitchen-tested recipes and step-by-step tutorials have given millions of readers the knowledge and confidence to bake from scratch. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Chocolate Hand Pies", "description": "How to make delicious, warm, and gooey chocolate hand pies with chocolate pie dough and chocolate ganache filling!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "hand pies, chocolate hand pies, heart pies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/chocolate-hand-pies-4-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/chocolate-hand-pies-4-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/chocolate-hand-pies-4-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/chocolate-hand-pies-4.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-hand-pies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/4 cups (281g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 cup (21g) unsweetened natural or dutch-process cocoa powder", "2 Tablespoons (24g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, very cold and cubed", "1/2 cup (120ml) cold milk or heavy cream, plus more as needed*", "egg wash: 1 egg beaten with 1 Tablespoon (15ml) milk or heavy cream", "optional: 2 Tablespoons coarse sugar for topping", "one 4 ounce bar (113g) semi-sweet chocolate, coarsely chopped*", "1/2 cup (120ml) heavy cream*", "optional: 2 Tablespoons (31g) creamy peanut butter", "2 ounces (57g) semi-sweet chocolate, coarsely chopped*", "1 teaspoon canola or vegetable oil", "optional: 1 Tablespoon (16g) peanut butter"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, and cubed butter into a large food processor. Pulse 15-20x until coarse crumbs form. Alternatively, you can use a large bowl and pastry cutter. Slowly drizzle in the cold milk or cream while pulsing (or stirring). After all the milk or cream is added, the dough should look slightly shaggy and be a little soft. If it&#8217;s too dry, add another Tablespoon of milk or cream. Try not to overwork the dough. Divide the dough in half and form each into 1 inch thick discs. Wrap each disc tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours and up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-hand-pies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface (you can &#8220;flour&#8221; with cocoa powder too!), carefully roll out each pie dough with a rolling pin. Cut into heart shapes (using a 3-inch heart cookie cutter). Re-roll any scraps. Refrigerate the hearts as you prepare the filling. (I make room and refrigerate them on 2 baking sheets.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-hand-pies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Place chopped chocolate into a large bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once it begins to boil, immediately remove from heat then pour over the chocolate. Stir gently and slowly using a wooden spoon until the ganache is smooth. Stir in peanut butter, if using. Allow it to cool for 15 minutes. During this time, it will slowly thicken.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-hand-pies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-hand-pies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the hearts from the refrigerator. Top with another heart (lightly stretch the top heart slightly if needed to cover). Press down the top edges to seal, then use a fork to crimp the sides to completely seal. Brush the top of each hand pie with egg wash. Spray\u00a0a\u00a010&#215;15-inch baking pan\u00a0with nonstick spray or grease with butter, so the parchment paper sticks. Stop the mixer, pour in the sifted dry ingredients, then beat on low until the batter is completely combined. In this recipe, you're building layers of flavor starting with caramelized sugar. This recipe is an advanced baking recipe. Read through the entire recipe before beginning because there are several different components. It's also helpful to review my tutorial on how to blind bake pie crust. This pie is a wonderful make-ahead option because it needs time to set up in the refrigerator.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "butterscotch pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/butterscotch-pie-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/butterscotch-pie-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/butterscotch-pie-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/butterscotch-pie-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 unbaked Flaky Pie Crust\u00a0or\u00a0All-Butter Pie Crust (what I used)*", "optional egg wash: 1 large egg beaten with 1 Tablespoon milk", "3/4 cup (150g) packed light or dark brown sugar (I strongly recommend dark)", "3 Tablespoons (24g) cornstarch", "1 and 1/4 cups (300ml) whole milk (not low-fat or nondairy), at room temperature", "4 large egg yolks, at room temperature", "1/3 cup (67g) granulated sugar", "3 Tablespoons (45ml) water, at room temperature", "1 cup (240ml) heavy cream, at room temperature", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon bourbon, scotch, or rum (or replace with more vanilla)", "1 cup (240ml) heavy cream, cold", "2 Tablespoons (25g) packed light or dark brown sugar (I strongly recommend dark)", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "optional: salted caramel sauce, for drizzling on top"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make and chill the pie crust dough through step 5 in either recipe. It needs to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before rolling out (next step). The recipe makes 2 crusts, and you only need 1 for this pie, so save the other for another pie. (Pie dough freezes well!)", "name": "At least 2 hours ahead, make the pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface,\u00a0roll out one of the discs of chilled dough. Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is completely smooth. To make a lovely thick edge, I do not trim excess dough around the edges. Instead, fold the excess dough back over the edge and use your hands to mold the edge into a rim around the pie. Crimp the edges with a fork or use your fingers to flute the edges. (Review this how to crimp and flute pie crust page if you need extra help with this step.) If dough is too warm, fluting/crimping will be difficult, so you can always chill it in the refrigerator for 5\u201310 minutes first. After fluting/crimping the edges, chill the shaped pie crust in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, and up to 5 days. Cover the pie crust with plastic wrap if chilling for longer than 30 minutes. Chilling the shaped dough helps prevent the crust from shrinking.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the crust is chilling, preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line the chilled pie crust with parchment paper. (It helps to scrunch up the parchment paper first so that you can easily fit it into the crust.) Fill with pie weights or dried beans. (Note that you will need at least 2 standard sets of pie weights for this.) I like to push the weights up against the sides of the pie crust to help ensure the sides don&#8217;t shrink down. Bake until the edges of the crust are starting to brown, about 15\u201316 minutes. Remove pie crust from the oven and carefully lift the parchment paper (with the weights) out of the pie. Prick holes all over the bottom crust with a fork. If desired for a shiny golden crust, brush egg wash on edges. Return pie crust to the oven and bake for 14\u201315 minutes, or until the bottom has browned. Remove from the oven, and place on a cooling rack to cool before filling. You can blind bake the crust up to 3 days ahead of time. Cover cooled crust tightly and refrigerate until ready to fill. (Review this how to par-bake pie crust page if you need extra help with this blind-baking step.)", "name": "Blind bake the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl (preferably with a pour spout), whisk together dark brown sugar and cornstarch. Add in whole milk and egg yolks, and whisk until combined; try to rid any large brown sugar clumps. Don&#8217;t worry if the egg yolks separate a bit. It will all come together on the stove. Set mixture aside.", "name": "Make the butterscotch filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place granulated sugar and water in a medium or large stainless steel saucepan (do not use nonstick) and cook over medium heat. Whisk or stir until the sugar and water are combined, and then stop stirring. Use a water-moistened pastry brush to brush down any sugar on the sides of the pan, to prevent it from crystallizing. Cook, picking up and swirling the pan occasionally, until the sugar mixture turns amber-brown, about 5 to 7 minutes. Reduce the heat down to low. Pouring very slowly, whisk in a little of the heavy cream. The mixture will rapidly bubble and steam, so use caution. Continue slowly pouring in the remaining heavy cream a little at a time, whisking constantly. The cooked sugar syrup may clump up or stick to the bottom of the pot. That is completely normal, just keep cooking and whisking. Don&#8217;t give up! I promise it will come together.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once all of the heavy cream has been added and there are no more cooked sugar clumps, increase the heat back up to medium and whisk and cook the mixture for 2 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a slow and steady stream, pour the brown sugar-egg yolk mixture into the saucepan, whisking the entire time. Keep whisking until the mixture thickens and large bubbles begin to burst on the surface, about 5 minutes, give or take. All stoves are different, so use an instant-read thermometer to check for doneness. The cooked mixture is done when it reaches 195\u2013200\u00b0F (91\u201393\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from heat and whisk in the butter, salt, vanilla, and alcohol (or more vanilla). Let the filling cool for 5 minutes, give it another whisk, and then spread it evenly into the baked pie shell. I use an offset spatula for this, but the back of a spoon works, too. (It&#8217;s not a super thick layer of filling, because it&#8217;s so intensely flavorful.) The baked pie shell can either be completely cooled, or it can still be a bit warm. Just make sure it&#8217;s not piping hot.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate, uncovered, for at least 6 hours and up to 2 days. After 6 hours, cover it with plastic wrap with the plastic wrap touching the surface of the pie to help prevent condensation.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream, brown sugar, and vanilla extract on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3 minutes. Medium peaks are between soft/loose peaks and stiff peaks and are the perfect consistency for topping and piping on desserts. Pipe or spread the whipped cream on top of the pie. If desired, top with a few drizzles of salted caramel sauce.", "name": "When ready to serve, or up to 1 hour before serving, make the whipped cream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butterscotch-pie/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice and serve. The dough will be pretty sticky but if it&#8217;s extremely wet, add another 2 Tablespoons of flour. Gently shape the dough into a ball as best you can. Cover tightly. Review the video tutorial above and recipe notes below before beginning.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cinnamon roll cake, giant cinnamon roll", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake-4-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake-4-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake-4-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake-4.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 3/4 cups (344g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon salt", "2\u00a0and 1/4 teaspoons\u00a0Platinum Yeast from Red Star\u00a0(1\u00a0standard packet)*", "3/4 cup (180ml) whole milk", "1/4 cup (4 Tablespoons; 56g) unsalted butter", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/4 cup (4 Tablespoons; 56 g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1/4 cup (50g) packed light or dark brown sugar or granulated sugar", "1 Tablespoon ground cinnamon", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "2 Tablespoons (30ml) milk or heavy cream", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, sugar, salt, and yeast together. Set aside. Heat the milk and butter together in the microwave until the butter is melted and the mixture is warm to the touch, between 100-110\u00b0F, 38-43\u00b0C. Pour the warm milk mixture into the dry ingredients. Add the egg. Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a dough hook or paddle attachment, or using a silicone spatula and mixing by hand, beat/mix the mixture until a soft dough forms. The dough is ready when it gently pulls away from the sides of the bowl. If the dough is pretty sticky, beat/mix in 2-4 extra Tablespoons of flour. (Keep in mind that you want the dough to remain on the softer side.)", "name": "Make the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Keep the dough in the stand mixer and beat for an additional 5 full minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5 full minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise. You can also do a \u201cwindowpane test\u201d to see if your dough has been kneaded long enough: tear off a small (roughly golfball-size) piece of dough and gently stretch it out until it\u2019s thin enough for light to pass through it. Hold it up to a window or light. Does light pass through the stretched dough without the dough tearing first? If so, your dough has been kneaded long enough and is ready to rise. If not, keep kneading until it passes the windowpane test.", "name": "Knead the dough:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Form the dough into a ball on your work surface. Cover it with a clean towel, aluminum foil, or plastic wrap, then let it rest for 30 minutes at room temperature. Alternatively, the ball of dough can rest in a covered and lightly greased mixing bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After 30 minutes, use a rolling pin to roll the dough out into a 15&#215;12-inch rectangle. Evenly spread the softened butter on top. Mix the sugar and cinnamon together and sprinkle it all over the buttered dough.", "name": "Make the filling:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 9-inch round pie dish or 9-inch round cake pan with butter or nonstick spray.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "See the video tutorial and my step-by-step photos above for a visual of this shaping step. Using a very sharp knife or a pizza cutter, cut the dough into six 2-inch wide strips. Roll up one strip and place it in the center of the pan. Coil the remaining 5 strips around the center roll, starting each strip at the end of the previous one to make one large cinnamon roll. Some of the filling may spill out as you pick up the strips, so just sprinkle it on top of the cake when you&#8217;re done shaping it.", "name": "Shape the cinnamon roll cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Loosely cover the cake with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and allow it to rise in a relatively warm, draft-free environment for 1-2 hours or until double in size. (Tip: Rising at room temperature is usually fine, but on a particularly cold day, heat your oven to 150\u00b0F (66\u00b0C). Turn the oven off, place the shaped cake inside, and keep the door slightly ajar. This will be a warm environment for your dough to rise. After about 30 minutes, close the oven door to trap the air inside with the rising dough. When it\u2019s doubled in size, remove from the oven.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After the cake&#8217;s dough has doubled in size, preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. If you notice the top or edges browning too quickly, tent the cake with aluminum foil. While the giant cinnamon roll cake is baking, some spots may rise up more than other spots. That&#8217;s completely normal and expected from something this large. Simply remove the pan from the oven and, with the back of a spatula, press down the spots that are rising taller than others to help keep them even. Return to baking.", "name": "Bake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the finished cinnamon roll cake from the oven and cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, make the icing.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the icing ingredients together. If you want a thicker icing, whisk in more confectioners&#8217; sugar. If you want a thinner icing, whisk in more milk or cream. Drizzle all over warm cake and serve.", "name": "Make the icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The cinnamon roll cake is best enjoyed the same day it&#8217;s made, but will remain fresh covered tightly for up to 4 days in the refrigerator.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/giant-cinnamon-roll-cake/#instruction-step-11"}], "prepTime": "PT3H", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT3H30M", "recipeYield": ["9", "one 9-inch cake"], "recipeCategory": "Cake", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "95", "ratingValue": "5"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Giant Cinnamon Roll Cake | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "Learn how to make a giant cinnamon roll cake using my easy 7 ingredient homemade cinnamon roll dough and swirling it into one large cake. These cookies are soft, tender, and chewy with incredible flavor.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cream cheese sugar cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies-1-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies-1-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies-1-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies-1.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups (375g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 ounces (57g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon almond extract", "optional: 1/2 cup granulated sugar for rolling", "4 ounces (113g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (240g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "sprinkles"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the\u00a0flour, baking powder,\u00a0and salt together until combined. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and cream cheese together for 2 minutes on high speed until completely smooth and creamy. Add the granulated sugar and beat on medium high speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in the egg, vanilla, and almond extract on high speed. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On low speed, slowly mix the dry ingredients into\u00a0the wet ingredients until combined. The cookie dough will be thick. Cover dough tightly with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and chill for\u00a01\u00a0hour and up to 3 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator. If the cookie dough chilled longer than 3-4 hours, let it sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes. This makes the cookie dough easier to scoop and roll.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).\u00a0Line two\u00a0large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.\u00a0(Always recommended\u00a0for cookies.)\u00a0Set aside.\u00a0Pour the 1/2 cup of granulated sugar into a bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop and roll balls of dough, about 1.5 Tablespoons of dough each (I like using this medium cookie scoop). Roll each ball into granulated sugar then place on the baking sheets about 3 inches apart. Using the back of measuring cup or drinking glass, gently press down on each (see photo above).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 13-15\u00a0minutes, or until very lightly browned on the edges. My oven has hot spots and yours may too- so be sure to rotate the pan once during bake time. The baked cookies will look extremely soft in the centers when you remove them from the oven. Allow to cool for 5 minutes on the cookie sheet. Transfer to cooling rack to cool completely before frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium\u00a0bowl using a handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the cream cheese\u00a0and butter together on medium-high speed until creamy and no lumps remain, about 2 minutes. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar and vanilla extract. Beat on low speed for 20 seconds then increase to high speed until everything is completely combined and the frosting is creamy. Taste. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. Spread on each cooled cookie, then decorate with sprinkles.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cookies stay fresh covered at room temperature for up to 3 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1\u00a0week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}], "prepTime": "PT1H25M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT3H", "recipeYield": ["24", "24 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "22", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Helen"}, "datePublished": "2024-06-29", "reviewBody": "This is the best sugar cookie I have ever made and I am 80 years old. Medium size."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Rey :)"}, "datePublished": "2024-10-03", "reviewBody": "I\u2019ve been using this website since I was about 16(? Set aside.", "name": "For the Cinnamon Swirl", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-swirl-quick-bread/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, and salt together. In a medium bowl, whisk the sugar, milk, oil, sour cream, egg, and vanilla extract. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, then whisk just until combined. Avoid over-mixing. The batter should be thick and creamy.\u00a0", "name": "Make the Bread", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-swirl-quick-bread/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour/spread about half of the batter into the prepared loaf pan. Sprinkle almost all of the cinnamon-sugar evenly on top (reserve about 2 Tablespoons for topping). It&#8217;s a very thick layer of cinnamon-sugar. Carefully pour/spread the remaining batter evenly on top. The top layer of batter will try to stick to the cinnamon-sugar filling, making spreading a little more difficult, but use a spoon to carefully spread it out as best you can. Sprinkle the remaining 2 Tablespoons of cinnamon-sugar on top. Using a knife, make a large swirl down the loaf pan, as shown in the video tutorial. Avoid over-swirling, which will mix the layers together too much.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-swirl-quick-bread/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the bread for 50\u201365 minutes, tenting loosely with foil about halfway through to prevent the top from over-browning. Bread baked in an 8&#215;4-inch pan takes closer to 65 minutes. Poke the center of the bread with a toothpick. If it comes out clean, the bread is done. Remove from the oven and allow the bread to cool in the pan set on a cooling rack for 1 hour. After that, remove the bread from the pan and let it finish cooling directly on the rack.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-swirl-quick-bread/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle with icing, if using. To avoid a soggy crust, partially blind bake the dough as directed in the recipe below.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate pie, chess pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/chocolate-chess-pie-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/chocolate-chess-pie-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/chocolate-chess-pie-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/chocolate-chess-pie-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 unbaked Buttery Flaky Pie Crust\u00a0(what I used) or\u00a0All Butter Pie Crust*", "1 large egg white, lightly beaten", "1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter", "2 ounces (56g) semi-sweet chocolate, finely chopped", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "3 Tablespoons (16g) unsweetened natural or dutch-process cocoa powder", "1 teaspoon espresso powder", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/4 cup (60ml) heavy cream", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "2 large eggs + 1 large egg yolk", "optional for serving: whipped cream"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "I like to make sure my pie dough is prepared before I begin making this chocolate pie. Make pie dough the night before because it needs to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before rolling out and blind baking (next step).", "name": "Pie crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface, roll out one of the disks of chilled dough (use the 2nd pie crust for another recipe!). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is completely smooth. To make a lovely thick edge, I do not trim excess dough around the edges. Instead, fold the excess dough back over the edge and use your hands to mold the edge into a nice thick rim around the pie. Crimp the edges with a fork or use your fingers to flute the edges. Review my how to crimp and flute pie crust tutorial if you need extra help with this step.) Brush edges with egg wash/egg white. Carefully line the inside of the pie with two pieces of parchment paper, as shown in the photo below, then pour in the pie weights. Make sure the weights are evenly distributed around the pie dish. If it&#8217;s helpful, you can watch me do this exact step in my pecan praline pumpkin pie video tutorial. Chill the dough in the refrigerator or freezer for at least 30 minutes\u2014this helps prevent the crust from shrinking. You can actually fill with pie weights before or after chilling, it doesn\u2019t make a difference.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cold pie crust (with weights) for 15 minutes. Remove pie from the oven and carefully lift the parchment paper (with the weights) out of the pie. Prick holes all around the bottom crust with a fork. Return the pie crust to the oven and bake for 8 minutes to help set the bottom. Remove from the oven and set aside until step 7. You can pre-bake the crust up to 3 days ahead of time. Cover and store in the refrigerator (without weights) until ready to use.", "name": "Partially blind bake the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce oven to 325\u00b0F (163\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the butter into pieces so it melts evenly. Place in a large heat-proof bowl or double boiler. Add chopped chocolate. Melt in 20 second increments in the microwave, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Set aside and let cool for 2-3 minutes. In a large bowl, whisk the sugar, cocoa powder, espresso powder, and salt together until combined. Whisk in the heavy cream, vanilla, 2 eggs, and 1 egg yolk. Finally, whisk in the cooled butter/chocolate.", "name": "For the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour filling into pre-baked pie crust (crust can still be warm). Bake for 50-55 minutes or until the center is no longer jiggly. It can still be a little sticky in the very center on top, just as long as it no longer jiggles when you lightly tap the pan. During bake time, if you find the edges of the pie crust are browning too quickly, apply a pie crust shield or a ring of aluminum foil to protect it.", "name": "Bake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove finished pie from the oven. Place on a wire rack to cool completely or for at least 2 hours. The pie filling will sink and set as it cools.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-pie/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Garnish with whipped cream, if desired. Set topping aside or refrigerate until ready to use.", "name": "Make the crumb topping, if using", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/master-muffin-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon (if using) together. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the sour cream, eggs, and vanilla. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute, then turn up to high speed until the mixture is combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/master-muffin-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and beat on low speed until just about combined. Bake for an additional 15\u201318 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The total time these muffins take in the oven is about 22\u201323 minutes, give or take. Allow the muffins to cool for 10 minutes in the muffin pan set on a cooling rack, then transfer the muffins from the pan to the rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/master-muffin-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Store muffins covered tightly at room temperature for up to 5 days, or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/master-muffin-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "recipeYield": ["12", "12-14 muffins"], "recipeCategory": "Muffins", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "198", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Ultimate Muffins Recipe | Sally's Baking", "description": "This is my ultimate muffin recipe\u2014starting with a thick and creamy muffin batter, your choice of additions, and two topping options. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Chewy Chocolate Covered Pretzel Cookies", "description": "Deliciously chewy chocolate covered pretzel cookies are a fun, salty sweet twist on the classic chocolate chip cookie!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate covered pretzel cookies, chewy cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/4 cups (281g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, melted", "3/4 cup (135g) loosely packed light brown sugar", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg + 1 egg yolk, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 heaping cup chocolate covered pretzel pieces (homemade chocolate covered pretzels or store-bought)", "sea salt for sprinkling"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking soda, cornstarch, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk the melted butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar together until no brown sugar lumps remain. Whisk in the egg, then the egg yolk. Finally, whisk in the vanilla extract. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix together with a large spoon or silicone spatula. The dough will be very soft, yet thick. Fold in the chocolate covered pretzel pieces. They may not stick to the dough because of the melted butter, but do your best to combine them. Cover the dough and chill in the refrigerator for 3 hours or up to 3 days. Chilling is mandatory. I highly recommend chilling the cookie dough overnight for less spreading.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator and allow to slightly soften at room temperature for 10 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to\u00a0325\u00b0F (163\u00b0C). Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll the dough into balls, about 3 Tablespoons of dough each. The dough will be crumbly, but the warmth of your hands will help the balls stay together. Roll the cookie dough balls to be taller rather than wide, to ensure the cookies will bake up to be thick. See this cake batter chocolate chip cookies post for more clarity and a photo. Place 8 balls of dough onto each cookie sheet, then sprinkle each with sea salt. Bake the cookies for 12-13 minutes. The cookies will look very soft and underbaked. They will continue to bake on the cookie sheet. As they cool, feel free to press a couple extra pieces of chocolate covered pretzels into the tops of each cookie. It&#8217;s best to do this when the cookies are still warm. This is only for looks! Not mandatory at all. You can also sprinkle a little more sea salt on top of each cookie at this time, if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the cookies to cool on the cookie sheet for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chewy-chocolate-covered-pretzel-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT3H10M", "cookTime": "PT12M", "totalTime": "PT3H30M", "recipeYield": ["16", "16 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "2", "ratingValue": "4.5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Tampa Jennifer"}, "datePublished": "2021-01-10", "reviewBody": "I love your website and have made several recipes. Add to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. Beat in the oats, dried cherries, and white chocolate chips on low speed. Dough will be thick, yet very sticky. Chill the dough for 30-60 minutes in the refrigerator. I recommend using a cookie scoop since the dough can be sticky. Bake for 12-14 minutes until lightly browned on the sides. The centers will look very soft and under-baked. Have extra flour handy for steps 4 and 5.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "snickerdoodle blondies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/snickerdoodle-cookie-bars-blondies-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/snickerdoodle-cookie-bars-blondies-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/snickerdoodle-cookie-bars-blondies-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/snickerdoodle-cookie-bars-blondies.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-snickerdoodle-blondies/", "recipeIngredient": ["3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "3/4 cup (150g) packed\u00a0light brown sugar", "2 large eggs, room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "2 and 1/3 cups (291g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (180g) white chocolate morsels, plus 1 Tablespoon for topping", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "2 teaspoons ground cinnamon"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line a 9-inch square baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to easily lift the bars out of the pan. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-snickerdoodle-blondies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar together on medium-high speed until fluffy and light in color, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the eggs and vanilla extract, and then beat on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "name": "Make the blondies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-snickerdoodle-blondies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, cream of tartar, and salt together until combined. Pour into the wet ingredients, then beat on low speed until combined. Beat in 1 cup (180g) white chocolate morsels. The cookie dough will be thick and sticky.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-snickerdoodle-blondies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon half the dough into the prepared pan and press/spread it into an even layer. If using your hands to press it down, flour your hands first. This is a sticky dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-snickerdoodle-blondies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, mix together the sugar and cinnamon for the filling. Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar on top of the bottom layer, reserving 1 teaspoon for the top. Flour your hands, take a handful of the remaining dough and press it between your hands to flatten it. Place it on top of the cinnamon swirl layer. Repeat with the remaining dough, a handful at a time, re-flouring your hands as often as needed. Lay the &#8220;shingles&#8221; of dough gently next to one another, sort of like puzzle pieces. It&#8217;s ok if some of the cinnamon-sugar layer is exposed/not covered. Press the remaining white chocolate morsels into the top, and then lightly sprinkle the surface with remaining cinnamon-sugar.", "name": "For the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-snickerdoodle-blondies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until golden brown, about 32\u201335 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out mostly clean with only a few moist crumbs. Avoid over-baking.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-snickerdoodle-blondies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool completely in the pan set on a cooling rack, about 1 hour. It's soft, sweet, and tastes unbelievable.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "Blueberry Lemon Icebox Cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/lemon-blueberry-icebox-cake-5-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/lemon-blueberry-icebox-cake-5-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/lemon-blueberry-icebox-cake-5-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/lemon-blueberry-icebox-cake-5.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-lemon-icebox-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 teaspoons (6g) cornstarch", "2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) warm water", "2 cups (280g) fresh or frozen blueberries", "2 Tablespoons (25g) granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon lemon zest", "2\u00a0cups (480ml) heavy cream or heavy whipping cream", "1/4\u00a0cup (30g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice", "1 teaspoon lemon zest", "7-8 full-sheet graham crackers (about 1 standard sleeve)", "optional: additional lemon zest and blueberries for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "There are 3 layers of graham crackers, 5 layers of whipped cream, and 2 layers of blueberry sauce. Each layer of graham crackers is about 2 full graham crackers (you can break some up to fit). This recipe yields 4 cups of whipped cream and you will use a little under 1 cup per layer (about \u00be cup).", "name": "Preliminary notes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-lemon-icebox-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cornstarch, lemon juice, and warm water together in a small bowl until the cornstarch has dissolved. Set aside. Warm the blueberries and sugar together in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir continuously for 3 minutes until the blueberry juices begin to release. Add the cornstarch mixture and continue to stir for another 2-3 minutes, smashing some blueberries as you go. The mixture will start to thicken. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon zest. Set aside to cool completely (stick in the fridge to speed it up).", "name": "Make the blueberry sauce", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-lemon-icebox-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a 9&#215;5-inch loaf pan with plastic wrap with overhang over the edges to easily lift the cake out. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-lemon-icebox-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk\u00a0attachment, beat the heavy cream,\u00a0confectioners&#8217; sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest together on medium-high speed until soft peaks form, about 3 minutes.", "name": "Make the whipped cream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-lemon-icebox-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread a couple Tablespoons of whipped cream into a very, very thin layer on the bottom of the prepared pan. This will help the bottom layer of graham crackers stick. Layer graham crackers on top. Spread about \u00be cup of whipped cream on top of the graham crackers. Then layer half of the blueberry sauce on top, another \u00be cup whipped cream, another layer of graham crackers, \u00be cup whipped cream, the rest of the blueberry sauce, \u00be cup whipped cream, graham crackers, then the rest of the whipped cream. If desired, sprinkle with additional blueberries and lemon zest.", "name": "Assemble cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-lemon-icebox-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover with aluminum foil or plastic wrap\u00a0and place in the freezer for at least 4 hours or overnight.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberry-lemon-icebox-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow to soften in the refrigerator for 1 hour before serving OR at room temperature for 10-15 minutes. Remove the cake from the pan using the overhang on the sides. For best results, follow the recipe as written including sufficiently cooling and chilling the bars.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "peanut butter cheesecake bars", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars-with-chocolate-ganache-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars-with-chocolate-ganache-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars-with-chocolate-ganache-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars-with-chocolate-ganache.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/", "recipeIngredient": ["30 regular Oreos", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, melted", "24 ounces (678g) full-fat brick PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1/4 cup (60g) sour cream or plain yogurt, at room temperature", "1 cup (250g) creamy peanut butter\u00a0(not natural style)", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "3 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter", "1\u00a0heaping cup (around 200g) semi-sweet\u00a0chocolate chips"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line the bottom and sides of a 9&#215;13-inch baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to lift the finished bars out (makes cutting easier!). Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0In a food processor or blender, pulse 30 Oreos (including the cream filling) into a fine crumb. You should have about 3 cups crumbs, or 330g. Pour crumbs into a large bowl. Add the melted butter and stir to combine. The mixture will be thick and quite wet. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Pour the mixture into prepared pan. With medium pressure using your hand, pat the crumbs down into the bottom to make a compact, thick crust. Pre-bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside. Leave oven on.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed in a large bowl until the mixture is smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the sour cream and beat until fully combined. Then add the peanut butter, vanilla extract, and salt and beat until fully combined. On medium speed, add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition until just blended. After the 3rd egg is incorporated into the batter, stop mixing. A few small lumps can remain. Whisk the filling a few times by hand to rid any large lumps at the bottom of the bowl.", "name": "For the peanut butter cheesecake filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the cheesecake filling onto the crust. It&#8217;s ok if the crust is still warm. Spread evenly on top with a rubber spatula or back of a spoon. (It will seem like a thick layer of cheesecake filling; that&#8217;s ok.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 35\u201338 minutes or until the cheesecake appears set on top and the edges are browned. The edges may slightly crack. (Mine do!) The bars will be puffy, but will sink slightly down as they cool. Place pan on a wire rack. Cool for 1 hour at room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator for at least 3\u20134 hours (and up to 1 day) before topping with chocolate. If you&#8217;re in a rush, place in the freezer for 2 hours (or until chilled throughout.) If you plan to chill the bars for longer than a few hours, loosely cover with aluminum foil after 3\u20134 hours of chilling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the butter into Tablespoon-size pieces. Place into a heat-proof bowl. Pour chocolate chips on top. Place in the microwave and melt in 30-second increments until smooth, stopping and stirring after each. You can also melt together on the stove, stirring constantly until smooth. Let the mixture cool for 2\u20133 minutes, then pour and spread evenly over chilled cheesecake bars. The cheesecake bars usually have a lip around the border since the center slightly sinks down, so it&#8217;s easy to spread the chocolate topping, stopping around the border/lip. If yours don&#8217;t have a raised lip around the edges, don&#8217;t worry and just spread the filling evenly all over the top.", "name": "For the chocolate topping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Chill in the refrigerator for 45\u201360 minutes or in the freezer for 30 minutes until the chocolate topping has set. If chilling for longer than 1 hour, loosely cover with aluminum foil after 1 hour of chilling. Chocolate topping must be completely set and solid on top of the cheesecake bars before slicing.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To slice, lift the bars out of the pan as a whole using the parchment overhang on the sides. Cut into squares with a sharp knife. For extra neat squares, wipe the knife clean between each cut.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover cheesecake bars in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars/#instruction-step-9"}], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT36M", "totalTime": "PT6H5M", "recipeYield": ["24", "24 squares"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "46", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Chocolate Peanut Butter Cheesecake Bars | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "These chocolate peanut butter cheesecake bars are like eating a peanut butter cup in cheesecake form. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-ginger-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed until creamed, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg, lemon juice, lemon zest, and vanilla extract and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-ginger-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. Beat in 2 Tablespoons of chopped crystallized ginger. Dough will be thick and sticky. Scoop small sections of dough (about 1 scant Tablespoon of dough each) and roll into balls. Very lightly dip the tops of each into remaining crystallized ginger. (You don&#8217;t want too much\u2014just a few pieces.) Place dough balls onto a large plate or lined baking sheet.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-ginger-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and chill the cookie dough balls in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour (and up to 4 days).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-ginger-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).
