For best taste and texture, and to avoid overwhelming your mixer, make each tier (cake) and each batch of frosting separately.\u00a0", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "wedding cake, layer cake, tiered cake, vanilla cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/homemade-2-tier-wedding-cake-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/homemade-2-tier-wedding-cake-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/homemade-2-tier-wedding-cake-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/homemade-2-tier-wedding-cake-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 and 2/3 cups (433g) cake flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "1 teaspoon\u00a0baking powder", "3/4 teaspoon\u00a0baking soda", "1 and 1/2 cups (340g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (400g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "3\u00a0large\u00a0eggs\u00a0+\u00a02\u00a0additional\u00a0egg whites, at room temperature", "1 Tablespoon\u00a0pure vanilla extract\u00a0(yes, Tbsp!)", "3/4 cup (180g) full-fat sour cream,\u00a0at room temperature", "3/4 cup (180ml) whole milk,\u00a0at room temperature", "1 and 3/4 cups (207g) cake flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/4 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "3/4 teaspoon\u00a0baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon\u00a0baking soda", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup\u00a0(200g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "1\u00a0large\u00a0egg + 1 additional egg white, at room temperature", "2\u00a0teaspoons\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "1/2 cup\u00a0(120g) full-fat\u00a0sour cream,\u00a0at room temperature", "1/2 cup\u00a0(120ml)\u00a0whole milk,\u00a0at room temperature", "2 cups (452g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "8 cups (960g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "6 Tablespoons (90ml) whole milk or heavy cream", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "4\u00a0\u2013\u00a05\u00a0cups\u00a0(480-600g)\u00a0confectioners\u2019 sugar", "1/4 cup\u00a0(60ml)\u00a0heavy cream\u00a0or\u00a0whole milk", "1 teaspoon\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "salt, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before beginning this recipe, watch the video tutorial above, read the entire blog post, read the recipe instructions, and review the recipe notes. Make sure you&#8217;re prepared with the recommended special tools, which are listed right above this recipe and in the recipe Notes section.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease three 9&#215;2 inch round cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "name": "Make each cake separately. Start with the bottom tier (9-inch cake)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cake flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together. Set aside. Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Beat in the 3 eggs, 2 egg whites, and vanilla extract on high speed until combined, about 2 minutes. (Mixture will look curdled as a result of the egg liquid and solid butter combining.) Beat in the sour cream. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. Do not over-mix. Whisk it all by hand a few times to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. The batter will be slightly thick. You&#8217;ll have 8-9 cups of cake batter. Pour batter evenly into cake pans. Weigh them to ensure accuracy, if desired. Bake for around 23-26 minutes or until the cakes are baked through. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it\u2019s done. Allow cakes to cool completely in the pans set on a wire cooling rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Keep the oven on.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "prepare three 6&#215;2 inch round cake pans just as you did with the 9-inch cake pans in step 2. (Greasing with parchment paper rounds.)", "name": "For the top tier (6-inch cake)\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the 6-inch cake batter the same exact way as the bottom tier. You&#8217;ll have about 4 cups of cake batter. The batter will be thinner than the bottom tier&#8217;s cake batter. Pour batter evenly into cake pans. Weigh them to ensure accuracy, if desired. Bake for around 18-22 minutes or until the cakes are baked through. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it\u2019s done. Allow cakes to cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a large serrated knife, slice a thin layer off the tops of all the cakes to create a flat surface. This is called leveling off the cakes. Discard the leveled off piece (or crumble over ice cream!).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners\u2019 sugar, milk, vanilla extract, and salt with the mixer running on low. Increase to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. Add more confectioners\u2019 sugar if frosting is too thin, more milk if frosting is too thick, or an extra pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet.", "name": "Make the frosting for the 9-inch cake (which is enough for the piping detail, too)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "You can prepare the rest of the frosting now (step 11), if desired, or begin decorating the 9-inch tier. Place your 9-10 inch cake board on your cake turner. Place 1 cake layer on your cake board. Using a large icing spatula, evenly cover the top with a scant 1 and 1/2 cups of frosting. Top with 2nd cake layer and evenly cover the top with a scant 1 and 1/2 cups of frosting. Top with the third cake layer. Using about 1-1 and 1/4 cups of frosting, spread it all over the top and sides in a thin layer, also called a crumb coat. A large icing spatula and bench scraper are helpful for applying the crumb coat. Set leftover frosting aside at room temperature. If you are decorating this cake in stages over 1-2 days, cover and refrigerate this leftover frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using the cake board to pick up the cake (be careful, it&#8217;s heavy), place the cake in the refrigerator to help set the crumb coat as you work on the top tier.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the frosting for the 6-inch cake, just as you prepared the 1st batch of frosting. (Step 8.) Before adding any salt, taste the frosting, then add a pinch if desired. I always add a small pinch.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place your 6-inch cake board on your cake turner. Place 1 6-inch cake layer on your cake board. Using a small icing spatula, evenly cover the top with a scant 3/4 cup of frosting. Top with 2nd cake layer and evenly cover the top with a scant 3/4 cup of frosting. Top with the third cake layer. Using about 3/4 cup of frosting, spread it all over the top and sides in a thin layer, also called a crumb coat. A small icing spatula and bench scraper are helpful for applying the crumb coat. Set leftover frosting aside at room temperature. If you are decorating this cake in stages over 1-2 days, cover and refrigerate this leftover frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using the cake board to pick up the 6-inch cake, carefully place the cake in the refrigerator to help set the crumb coat as you work on the exterior frosting on the top tier.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-13"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the bottom tier from the refrigerator (along with the cake board) and place on the cake turner. Apply the remaining frosting for the bottom tier on the cake, reserving about 6-8 Tablespoons for piping detail. I recommend a large icing spatula and bench scraper to apply the outer layer of frosting. For the decorative textured frosting as pictured, see my video above. As shown in the video, use a small icing spatula and run it around the cake while spinning with the cake turner. You will love this look because it&#8217;s very easy, but resembles beautiful ruffles. Carefully lift the cake (with the cake board) and place on your serving platter or cake stand.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-14"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wash and dry 4 cake dowels. Measure the height of the bottom cake. Measure and cut the cake dowels to match. Staying within a 6 inch circle diameter (you can use another 6 inch cake board to &#8220;imprint&#8221; a 6-inch circle in the very center of the top of the 9-inch cake), insert the dowels into the cake, spacing them about 2 inches apart to form 4 corners of a square. Push the dowels straight down until each touches the bottom cake board. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-15"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the top tier from the refrigerator (along with the cake board) and place on the cake turner. Decorate just as you did the bottom tier, including the ruffled textured frosting. I also turn the cake on the cake turner and apply this ruffled look on top of the 6-inch cake, too. This is optional. Along with the cake board, carefully lift the small cake and gently place it in the very center of the bottom tier.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-16"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After placing the small tier on top, you can pipe leftover frosting around the bottom of it. This covers up any spaces or smears that may have appeared when arranging the top tier. I pipe dots of frosting with Wilton piping tip #12 between the tiers as well as around the bottom of the whole cake. They resemble pretty pearls. To smooth down pointy peaks on these &#8220;pearls,&#8221; moisten your fingertip with water and gently press down on the peak.", "name": "Piping", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-17"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add any decorative pieces, such as artificial flowers.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-18"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate cake until ready to serve. After a few hours, the frosting will &#8220;set&#8221; and you can lightly cover with plastic wrap.", "name": "Cake is best enjoyed within 3 days", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-19"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover any leftover cake tightly and refrigerate for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-wedding-cake/#instruction-step-20"}], "prepTime": "PT5H", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT6H", "recipeYield": ["30", "30-35 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "82", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Simple Homemade Wedding Cake Recipe | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "How to make a simple, yet elegant homemade wedding cake. Complete with the buttery crust, slightly sweet tomato sauce, and a thick layer of cheese. This recipe makes two deep dish 9-inch pizzas. Make them both if you have a family of 4-5 or are having friends over. If your family is smaller, freeze half of the dough per the make-ahead/freezing instructions in the recipe notes.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "deep dish pizza, chicago style deep dish pizza", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/Chicago-Style-Deep-Dish-Pizza-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com_-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/Chicago-Style-Deep-Dish-Pizza-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com_-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/Chicago-Style-Deep-Dish-Pizza-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com_-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/Chicago-Style-Deep-Dish-Pizza-Recipe-on-sallysbakingaddiction.com_.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 and 1/4 cups (406g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/2 cup (60g) yellow cornmeal", "1 and 1/4 teaspoons salt", "1 Tablespoon (12g) granulated sugar", "2 and 1/4 teaspoons (7g) Platinum Yeast from Red Star instant yeast (1 standard packet)*", "1 and 1/4 cups (300ml) slightly warm water", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, divided (1/4 cup melted, 1/4 cup softened to room temperature)", "olive oil for coating", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter", "1 small onion, grated (about 1/3 cup)*", "3/4 teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon dried oregano", "1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (optional, but recommended)", "3 garlic cloves, minced", "one 28-ounce can (794g) crushed tomatoes*", "1/4 teaspoon granulated sugar", "4 cups (about 16 oz) shredded mozzarella cheese*", "1/2 cup (45g) grated parmesan cheese", "optional: 1/2 cup sliced pepperoni", "optional: 4 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Please use my step-by-step photos below this written out recipe as a guide to making the pizza. For best results and ease of mind, read through the recipe completely before beginning. You will need two deep dish 9&#215;2-inch round cake pans if you are making both pizzas at the same time. You can also use 9-inch springform pans.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the flour, cornmeal, salt, sugar, and yeast in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook attachment. If you do not have a stand mixer, use your hand mixer and a very very large bowl. If you do not have any mixer, you will do this all by hand. Again, use a very large bowl. Give those ingredients a quick toss with your mixer on low or with a large wooden spoon. Add the warm water and 1/4 cup of melted butter. The warm water should be around 90\u00b0F (32\u00b0C). Make sure it is not very, very hot or it will kill the yeast. Likewise, make sure the butter isn&#8217;t boiling hot. If you melt it in the microwave, let it sit for 5 minutes before adding. On low speed, beat (or stir) the dough ingredients until everything begins to be moistened. Continuing on low speed (or remove from the bowl and knead by hand if you do not own a mixer), beat the dough until it is soft and supple and gently pulls away from the sides of the bowl and falls off of the dough hook- about 4-5 minutes. If the dough is too hard (it will be textured from the cornmeal), but if it feels too tough, beat in 1 teaspoon of warm water. Alternatively, if it feels too soft, beat in 1 Tablespoon of flour.", "name": "For the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the dough from the bowl and form into a ball. Lightly grease a large mixing bowl with olive oil and place the dough inside, turning it around so that all sides of the dough are coated in the oil. Cover the bowl tightly with aluminum foil and allow to rise in a warm environment for 1-2 hours or until double in size.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the dough is ready, lightly flour a large work surface. Remove dough from the bowl, set the bowl and aluminum foil aside (to use later). Gently punch down the dough to remove any air bubbles and roll the dough into a large 15&#215;12-inch rectangle. Spread 1/4 cup of softened butter on top of the dough. Roll it up lengthwise per the photos below. Cut the dough log in half. Form the two pieces of dough into balls and place back into your greased bowl. Cover with aluminum foil and allow to rise in the refrigerator (not in a warm place) for 1 hour until they are puffy as you make the sauce.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat and allow it to melt. Once melted, add the grated onion, salt,\u00a0oregano, and red pepper flakes. Once the onion has slightly browned after about 5 minutes, add the garlic,\u00a0tomatoes, and sugar. Turn the heat down to low-medium and\u00a0allow it to\u00a0simmer until it&#8217;s hearty, fragrant, and thick- about 30 minutes. You&#8217;ll have about 2 and 1/2 cups of sauce at this point. If you have more than that, keep simmering until the amount has reduced. Remove from heat and set aside until ready to be used. You may store the sauce in a tightly covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days if planning to make the pizza another day. You may freeze this sauce for up to 2 months as well.", "name": "For the sauce", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425\u00b0F (218\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After the dough balls have risen in the refrigerator, they should be puffy. Keep one ball of dough in the refrigerator as you work with the first one. Roll it out on a lightly floured work surface, working it into a 12-inch circle. Using your rolling pin as a guide (see photos below), place over a 9&#215;2-inch deep dish cake pan. Using your fingers, press the dough into the cake pan. Make sure it is nice and tight fitting inside the pan. Trim any excess dough off the edges with a small knife. Repeat with 2nd dough. Brush the top edges of the dough with a little olive oil, which gives the crust a beautiful sheen. Fill each pizza with 1/2 of the cheese (about 2 cups/8 oz per pizza), then the pepperoni and bacon or your desired toppings. Pour about 1 and 1/4 cups (300ml) of sauce evenly on top of each. If you do not like that much sauce, you can reduce to 3/4 cup (180ml) per pizza and have leftover sauce. Sprinkle each with 1/4 cup (22g) of grated parmesan cheese.", "name": "Assemble the pizzas", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cake pans on top of a large baking sheet, which will catch anything potentially spilling over the sides of the pans. (Nothing usually does.) Bake for 20-28 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Feel free to loosely cover the pizzas with aluminum foil after the 15 minute mark to prevent any heavy browning and uneven baking. Remove the pizzas from the oven and allow to cool in the pans placed on a wire rack for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, slice, serve, and enjoy.\u00a0Place\u00a0any leftover pizza in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 5 days. \u00a0Reheat leftovers in a 300\u00b0F (149\u00b0C) oven for 15-20 minutes or until hot.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-chicago-style-deep-dish-pizza/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT4H", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT4H30M", "recipeYield": ["2", "2 deep dish 9-inch pizzas"], "recipeCategory": "Dinner", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "204", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Beth"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-04", "reviewBody": "As a born and raised Chicago Deep Dish pizza lover, this recipe is AMAZING. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Pi\u00f1ata Cake", "description": "This cake serves a lot so, as expected, there are high amounts of each ingredient. You will need four 9-inch round cake pans as well as a 3 and 1/2 - 4 inch circle cookie cutter or you can carefully slice a hole in the center cakes with a sharp knife.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "pi\u00f1ata cake, how to make a pi\u00f1ata cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/How-to-Make-a-Pinata-Cake-8-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/How-to-Make-a-Pinata-Cake-8-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/How-to-Make-a-Pinata-Cake-8-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/How-to-Make-a-Pinata-Cake-8.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-a-pinata-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 and 3/4 cups (443g) sifted all-purpose flour* (spooned &amp; leveled)", "3/4 teaspoon baking powder", "3/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon salt", "1 and 1/2 cups (340g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (400g) granulated sugar", "3 large eggs, room temperature", "4 large egg yolks, room temperature", "3 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 and 1/2 cups (360ml) buttermilk, room temperature*", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "4 and 1/2 cups (540g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "3/4 cup (62g) natural unsweetened or dutch-process cocoa powder", "1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk", "1 Tablespoon light corn syrup*", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "around 2 cups assorted candies*", "optional: additional sprinkles or candies for decorating the cake"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease and lightly flour 4 9-inch round cake pans*, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-a-pinata-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside. Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add the sugar and beat on high speed for 5 full minutes until creamed together fairly well. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. On medium-high speed, add 1 whole egg at a time, beating well after each addition until all 3 whole eggs are mixed in. Then, repeat with each egg yolk until all 4 egg yolks are mixed in. Beat in the vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-a-pinata-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients, and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not overmix this batter. The batter will be smooth, velvety, and slightly thick.\u00a0Spoon/pour batter evenly into each cake pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-a-pinata-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for around 25 minutes or until the cakes are baked through.\u00a0To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it is done. Allow cakes to cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-a-pinata-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until pale, smooth, and creamy, about 2 minutes. Using a fine mesh strainer or sieve, sift the confectioners&#8217; sugar and cocoa together. Add the sugar/cocoa mixture to the butter, then beat on low speed for 20 seconds. Stop the mixer, then add the milk, corn syrup, vanilla, and salt. Beat on medium-high speed for 2 minutes. If the frosting is too thick, beat in an extra splash of milk.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-a-pinata-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Grab a 3 and 1/2- to 4-inch circle cookie cutter (I use a large thin-edged cup) and cut a hole into two of the cake layers. Alternatively, you can cut a piece of parchment paper that size and use a sharp knife to trace/cut the holes. Place one of the whole cakes on a cake turntable, cake stand or serving plate. Use an offset spatula or knife to frost the top of the cake, then place one of the cut/holed cakes on top. Frost the top and inside the cavity. Place the other cut/holed cake on top and, once again, frost the top and inside the cavity. Fill the cavity with candies all the way up to the top. Place the last whole cake on top and frost the top and sides of the entire cake. Decorate with frosting and additional candies however you&#8217;d like. I used a Wilton 1M tip to pipe frosting around the top.", "name": "Assemble the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/how-to-make-a-pinata-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice, serve, enjoy! Set aside.", "name": "Make the streusel", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add the granulated and brown sugars and beat on high until creamed, about 2 full minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute, then turn up to high speed until the mixture is combined and uniform in texture.\u00a0Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "name": "Make the muffins:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-muffins/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, toss together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and slowly mix until combined and little lumps remain. Fold in the strawberries with a wooden spoon or rubber spatula. Don&#8217;t worry if the berries bleed a little\u2014my batter was pink-ish in some spots; it looks pretty when baked.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-muffins/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0In a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric handheld or stand mixer on medium-high speed until creamy. Add the egg yolk, vanilla extract, and sugar. Beat until combined.", "name": "Make the cheesecake filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-muffins/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon 1 Tablespoon of strawberry\u00a0muffin batter into the muffin cups. Layer with about 1 spoonful\u00a0(not quite a full Tablespoon)\u00a0of cheesecake filling, then another Tablespoon of muffin batter (or however much batter is needed to fill the cups all the way to the top). Yes, you will fill the muffin cups to the very top. Some cheesecake filling may poke out of the top or on the sides. Sprinkle each muffin evenly with streusel\u00a0topping and gently press the streusel\u00a0down into the muffin so it sticks.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-muffins/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the muffins for 5 minutes at 425\u00b0F (218\u00b0C). Keeping the muffins in the oven, lower the temperature down to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) and bake for an additional 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The total times these muffins take in the oven is about 23-24 minutes, give or take. Allow the muffins to cool for 10 minutes in the muffin sheet, then transfer to a wire rack to cool until ready to eat. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-cinnamon-star-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the egg, maple extract, and vanilla extract and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-cinnamon-star-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. Dough will be a bit soft. If the dough seems too soft and sticky for rolling, add 1 more Tablespoon of flour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-cinnamon-star-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the dough into 2 equal parts. Place each portion onto a piece of lightly floured parchment paper or a lightly floured silicone baking mat. With a lightly floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to about 1/4-inch thickness. Use more flour if the dough seems too sticky. The rolled-out dough can be any shape, as long as it is evenly 1/4-inch thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-cinnamon-star-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly dust one of the rolled-out doughs with flour. Place a piece of parchment on top. (This prevents sticking.) Place the 2nd rolled-out dough on top. Cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil, then refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours and up to 2 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-cinnamon-star-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, preheat oven to\u00a0350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line 2-3 large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Carefully remove the top dough piece from the refrigerator. If it\u2019s sticking to the bottom, run your hand under it to help remove it. Using a cookie cutter, cut into star shapes. Transfer the cut cookie dough to the prepared baking sheet. Re-roll the remaining dough and continue cutting until all is used. Repeat with 2nd piece of dough. (Note: It doesn\u2019t seem like a lot of dough, but you get a lot of cookies from the dough scraps you re-roll.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-cinnamon-star-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before baking, top with sprinkles. If your oven has hot spots, rotate the baking sheet halfway through bake time. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Blueberry Cream Cheese Pie", "description": "This blueberry cream cheese pie is best made ahead so the filling and topping can set and the pie slices neatly. The blueberry topping is jammy and sweet and you can make it with frozen blueberries, so this is a wonderful year-round dessert.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "blueberry cream pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/blueberries-and-cream-pie-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/blueberries-and-cream-pie-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/blueberries-and-cream-pie-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/blueberries-and-cream-pie-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 teaspoons cornstarch", "2 teaspoons lemon juice", "2 and 1/4 cups (around 315g) fresh or frozen\u00a0blueberries\u00a0(do not thaw)", "2 Tablespoons (25g) granulated sugar", "1\u00a0and 1/2 cups (180g)\u00a0graham cracker crumbs (about 12 full sheet graham crackers)", "1/4 cup (50g) granulated sugar", "6 Tablespoons\u00a0(85g)\u00a0unsalted butter, melted", "1 cup (240ml) cold heavy cream", "12 ounces (339g) full-fat brick\u00a0cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (90g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon lemon juice", "optional for topping:\u00a0homemade whipped cream"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a fork, mix the cornstarch and lemon juice together in a small bowl until the cornstarch has dissolved. Set aside. Warm the blueberries and sugar together in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook for 3 minutes stirring occasionally to help them thaw or break down some juices. Stir in the cornstarch mixture. Cook for 2 more minutes as the topping thickens and simmers, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and set aside at room temperature until step 5. (Must completely cool, so transferring to a bowl out of the saucepan helps speed that up. Feel free to refrigerate.)", "name": "Make the blueberry topping first so it can cool", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you\u2019re starting out with full graham crackers, use a\u00a0food processor or blender to grind them into fine crumbs. Stir the graham cracker crumbs and granulated sugar together in a medium bowl, and then stir in the melted butter. The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy. Try to smash/break up any large chunks. Pour the mixture into an ungreased 9-inch pie dish. With medium pressure using your hand, pat the crumbs down into the bottom and up the sides to make a compact crust. Do not pack down with heavy force because that makes the crust too hard. Simply pat down until the mixture is no longer crumby/crumbly. For more shaping technique tips, see the graham cracker crust recipe page. Bake the crust for 15 minutes, remove from the oven, and cool for just 15 minutes as you prepare the filling in the next step.", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the cold heavy cream into stiff peaks on medium-high speed, about 4 minutes. Set aside. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese on medium speed until smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the confectioners\u2019 sugar, vanilla extract, and lemon juice and beat on medium-high speed until combined. Make sure there are no large lumps of cream cheese. If there are lumps, keep beating until smooth. Using your mixer on low speed or a rubber spatula, fold the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture until combined. This takes several turns of your silicone spatula. Combine slowly as you don\u2019t want to deflate all the air in the whipped cream.", "name": "Make the filling:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread filling into slightly cooled crust. Use an offset spatula to smooth down the top. Spoon cooled blueberry filling evenly on top.", "name": "Assemble layers", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and refrigerate for at least 8 hours and up to 2 days. The longer refrigerated, the better the pie will set up. You could also freeze the pie for up to 3 months. Thaw in the refrigerator before serving.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Feel free to garnish the pie with whipped cream right before or a few hours before serving (keep pie refrigerated after adding whipped cream). I used Wilton 1M piping tip for the whipped cream in the pictured pie. Using a clean sharp knife, cut into slices for serving. For neat slices, wipe the knife clean between each slice. Tip: The first slice is never pretty! Much easier to slice after that 1st piece is out.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover pie in the refrigerator or freezer for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blueberries-cream-pie/#instruction-step-8"}], "prepTime": "PT45M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT9H", "recipeYield": ["9", "one 9-inch pie"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Whipping", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "35", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Blueberry Cream Cheese Pie.mov", "description": "This blueberry cream cheese pie combines a crunchy graham cracker crust, cheesecake filling, and homemade blueberry topping.", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/m2xUkhH3.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/m2xUkhH3-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2025-09-22T12:48:26+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lara"}, "datePublished": "2025-04-11", "reviewBody": "Easy and delicious. Step 3 is optional.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cheesecake, mini cheesecake, no-bake dessert", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/no-bake-cheesecakes-made-in-muffin-pan-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/no-bake-cheesecakes-made-in-muffin-pan-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/no-bake-cheesecakes-made-in-muffin-pan-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/no-bake-cheesecakes-made-in-muffin-pan.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-no-bake-cheesecakes/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups (240g) graham cracker crumbs (about 16 full sheet graham crackers)", "1/3 cup (67g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, melted", "1 cup (240ml) cold heavy cream or heavy whipping cream", "16 ounces (452g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1/3 cup (67g) granulated sugar", "2 Tablespoons (30g) sour cream or plain yogurt, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "optional: your desired toppings (see recipe Note)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line two standard 12-count muffin pans with cupcake liners. Make sure you have room in your refrigerator for both pans. (You refrigerate them in step 6.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-no-bake-cheesecakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If your graham crackers aren&#8217;t crumbs yet, use a food processor to pulse them into fine crumbs. Pour crumbs into a medium bowl and stir in the brown sugar and melted butter until combined. Mixture will have the consistency of wet sand. Spoon 1 and 1/2 Tablespoons of the crust mixture into each cupcake liner and use the back of the spoon to pack it down tightly.", "name": "Prepare the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-no-bake-cheesecakes/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The next step is optional. Though it&#8217;s not required, I recommend baking the crusts for a quick 5 minutes in a 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C) oven. The crusts are a little sturdier this way. However, if you can&#8217;t use an oven or simply don&#8217;t want to, you can skip this step. The crust will just be a bit crumblier. If baking, let the warm crusts cool for 10 minutes before adding the filling on top.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-no-bake-cheesecakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the cold heavy cream into stiff peaks on medium-high speed, about 3 minutes. Set aside. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and granulated sugar together on medium speed until smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the sour cream, lemon juice, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium-high speed until smooth and combined, about 1 minute. Make sure there are no large lumps of cream cheese. If there are lumps, keep beating until smooth. Using your mixer on low speed or a silicone spatula, fold the whipped cream into the cheesecake filling until combined. This takes several turns of your rubber spatula. Combine slowly as you don&#8217;t want to deflate all the air in the whipped cream.", "name": "Make the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-no-bake-cheesecakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "You can use a spoon or piping bag to transfer the filling on top of the crusts. Spoon or pipe about 2 Tablespoons of filling over each crust. I prefer piping the filling because it&#8217;s a little easier and neater. Fit your piping bag with a large star or round piping tip, then transfer the filling to the bag and pipe.\u00a0 (You could also use a plastic zipped-top bag. Spoon the filling inside, snip an end off a corner, and pipe.) Use the back of a spoon to smooth the tops so they are flat.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-no-bake-cheesecakes/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate the mini cheesecakes in the pans for at least 3 hours and up to 2 days. The reverse creaming method guarantees a soft crumb and the lavender milk and soaking syrup promise an aromatic, but not overpowering flavor.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lavender cake, cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/layer-lavender-cake-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/layer-lavender-cake-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/layer-lavender-cake-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/layer-lavender-cake.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (240ml) whole milk", "2 teaspoons dried culinary lavender", "1/2 cup (120ml) water", "1/2 cup (100g) granulated sugar", "2 teaspoons dried culinary lavender", "1/4 cup (60g) sour cream, at room temperature", "2 and 1/2 cups (295g) cake flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 and 1/2 cups (300g) granulated sugar", "1 Tablespoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, diced &amp; softened to room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "4 large eggs, at room temperature", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "8 ounces (226g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature*", "5 and 1/2 cups (660g) confectioners\u2019 sugar", "2 Tablespoons (30ml)\u00a0whole milk", "2 teaspoons\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "1/2 &#8211; 1 cup (120ml-240ml) blackberry jam", "optional: purple or mauve food coloring", "optional: blackberries for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small saucepan over low heat, bring the milk to a simmer. Remove from heat and immediately add the lavender. Set aside to steep for 20 minutes. Strain the milk through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl, then discard the lavender. Cool milk completely before using in cake batter. Can be made 1-2 days ahead and stored in the refrigerator. Bring to room temperature before using.", "name": "Make the lavender milk:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, bring the sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and add the lavender. Simmer the syrup for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and steep until completely cool. Strain the syrup through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl, then discard the lavender. You will use this &#8220;soaking syrup&#8221; in step 8. Can be made 1-2 days ahead. Cover and keep at room temperature until ready to use.", "name": "Make the lavender syrup", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease\u00a0three 8-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir the sour cream and cooled lavender milk together until combined. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sift the cake flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer. (Or if using a handheld mixer, any large mixing bowl.) With the paddle attachment, beat the ingredients together on low speed for a few seconds to gently combine. Add the butter, vanilla, and about 1/2 of the lavender milk/sour cream mixture. Mix on medium speed until the dry ingredients are moistened, about 1 minute. Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the eggs into the remaining lavender milk/sour cream mixture. With the mixer running on medium speed, add the egg mixture in 3 additions, mixing for about 15 seconds after each addition. Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl, then mix for about 15 more seconds until batter is completely combined. Avoid over-mixing.\u00a0 Some small lumps are OK.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour batter evenly into cake pans. If desired, weigh them to ensure accuracy. Bake for around 20-22 minutes or until the cakes are baked through. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it\u2019s done. Allow cakes to cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. The cakes must be completely cool before leveling and frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a large serrated knife, slice a thin layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Discard (or crumble over ice cream!). Generously brush lavender syrup on the top of each cake. I use every last drop!", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand-held mixer or stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the butter and cream cheese together on medium speed until creamy and smooth, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners\u2019 sugar, milk, vanilla extract, and salt with the mixer running on low. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes. Add more confectioners\u2019 sugar if frosting is too thin, more milk if frosting is too thick, or an extra pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. Frosting should be spreadable and creamy, not runny. If desired, divide frosting in half and tint half light purple. I used 2 drops of this mauve food coloring.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place 1 cake layer on your\u00a0cake stand,\u00a0cake turntable, or serving plate. Spread a thin layer of white frosting on top. Fill a piping bag fitted with a large round tip (I used Wilton 1A piping tip) with 1/2 cup of white frosting. (Or use a zipped-top bag with the corner snipped off.) Pipe a ring around the outer top edge of the cake to create a &#8220;dam.&#8221; Pipe a second ring of white frosting a couple inches in from the outer ring to create a &#8220;bull&#8217;s eye.&#8221; Spoon and spread blackberry jam in the gaps. Top with 2nd cake layer and repeat, then place 3rd cake layer on top. If there&#8217;s any remaining, spread a thin layer of white frosting all over the top and sides of cake to create a crumb coat. Chill in the refrigerator for 15 minutes. Finally, spread the purple frosting all over the top and sides. I use and recommend an icing spatula to apply the frosting.\u00a0If there&#8217;s any extra frosting, pipe decor on top. I piped a swirled border with Wilton 1M piping tip. Garnish with blackberries.", "name": "Assemble and decorate", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate cake for at least 20 minutes before slicing and serving. Its so good!!!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Char"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-18", "reviewBody": "I'm an advanced baker but a beginner layer cake baker wanting to grow my pastry skills. I made this cake and was very pleased with the flavors of lavender and the blackberry together. I made the frosting and cakes a day before, refrigerated, then brought everthing to room temp before assembling. Is the cake supposed to be light and fluffy? My cake turned out dense and somewhat dry (even with the lavender soak). I didn't have cake flour so I made my own substituting 2 TBSP corn starch for 2 TBSP all purpose flour per cup. I had read other posts where refrigerating cakes had a tendency to dry them out. I could have overmixed the batter as well."}], "datePublished": "2019-04-24", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/blackberry-lavender-cake/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id": Make pie dough the night before because it needs to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before rolling out (step 3).", "name": "Pie crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Place sweet potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover them with water, then bring to a boil on the stovetop. Boil for 45-50 minutes, or until super soft. During this time, begin step 3.", "name": "As the pie dough chills, start the sweet potatoes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a floured work surface, roll out one of the disks of chilled dough (use the 2nd pie crust for another recipe or freeze). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is completely smooth. To make a lovely thick edge, I do not trim excess dough around the edges. Instead, fold the excess dough back over the edge and use your hands to mold the edge into a nice thick rim around the pie. Crimp the edges with a fork or use your fingers to flute the edges. (Review my how to crimp and flute pie crust tutorial if you need extra help with this step.) Brush edges with egg wash. Chill the dough in the refrigerator or freezer for at least 15 minutes as you work on the filling\u2014this helps prevent the crust from shrinking.", "name": "Roll out the chilled pie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drain the boiling water and run the potatoes under very cold water. The skin should peel off easily at this point. Cool for a few minutes until easy to handle. Slice the potatoes into a couple large chunks, then place into a mixing bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment (or you can use a blender for this), beat/blend the potatoes on medium-high speed until smooth. Add the remaining filling ingredients and beat/blend on high speed until smooth and combined. Spread filling into prepared pie crust.", "name": "For the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 55-60 minutes or until the center of the pie is only slightly jiggly. A toothpick inserted into the center of the pie should come out *mostly* clean. During bake time, if you find the edges of the pie crust are browning too quickly, apply a\u00a0pie crust shield\u00a0or a ring of aluminum foil to protect it.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove finished pie from the oven. Place on a wire rack to cool completely or for at least 2 hours. The pie filling will sink and set as it cools.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place egg whites, sugar, and cream of tartar in a heatproof bowl. Set bowl over a saucepan filled with two inches of simmering water. Do not let it touch the water. (You can use a double boiler if you have one.) Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved and mixture has thinned out, about 4 minutes. The mixture&#8217;s temperature taken with an instant read thermometer should be 160\u00b0F (71\u00b0C). If it&#8217;s not, keep cooking and whisking until thinned out and temperature is warm enough. Remove from heat. Add the vanilla extract, then using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat on high speed for 5 minutes until stiff glossy peaks form. You can read more about and watch me make this in my separate marshmallow meringue frosting post.", "name": "For the marshmallow meringue", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread marshmallow cream on top of cooled pie. Serve immediately or store at room temperature or in the refrigerator uncovered up to 8 hours before serving. If desired, toast the marshmallow topping with a kitchen torch just before serving. If you want to use the oven to toast instead, see detailed recipe Note.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftovers at room temperature for 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bourbon-sweet-potato-pie/#instruction-step-11"}], "prepTime": "PT3H30M", "cookTime": "PT1H", "totalTime": "PT7H", "recipeYield": ["1", "1 9-inch pie"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "Southern", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "23", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "3"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Olga"}, "datePublished": "2025-11-27", "reviewBody": "I was really excited to try this pie and convince my husband that sweet potato pie is yum. Stir until the butter has melted. Bring mixture to a simmer. Once simmering, reduce heat to low and add the flour all at once. Stir until the flour is completely incorporated and a thick dough clumps into a ball. Mash the dough ball against the bottom and sides of the pan for 1 minute, which gently cooks the flour. Remove from heat and transfer to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment or, if using a handheld mixer, a large mixing bowl. Allow to cool down for a few minutes before adding the eggs in the next step.", "name": "Make the choux pastry dough:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/choux-pastry/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer running on low speed, slowly add the eggs in 3-4 separate additions mixing for 30 seconds between each. The mixture will look curdled at first, but will begin to come together as the mixer runs. Pour in the final addition of beaten eggs very slowly. Stop adding when the choux pastry has reached the desired texture: shiny, thick, and smooth with a pipeable consistency. I usually leave a few teaspoons of beaten egg behind, which can be used with the egg wash.", "name": "Read this step in full before starting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/choux-pastry/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Your choux pastry dough is complete! You can use it immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. There&#8217;s no need to bring it to room temperature after refrigerating. If it&#8217;s too stiff to pipe, though, let it warm to room temperature a bit as the oven preheats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/choux-pastry/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to\u00a0400\u00b0F (204\u00b0C). Generously spray a 9-inch springform pan* with cooking spray or grease with butter. Sprinkle the bottom of the pan with 1 Tablespoon of flour and tap out the excess.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/super-crumb-coffee-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, sugar, and salt together in a large mixing bowl until combined. Cut in the butter in very small pieces using a pastry blender or mix with a fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Place 1 cup of the butter/flour mixture in the refrigerator until ready to use in step 4.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/super-crumb-coffee-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer with a paddle attachment, mix the baking powder and baking soda into the remaining flour mixture. Add the room temperature buttermilk, egg, and vanilla and beat on medium speed until smooth. The batter is very thick. Spoon the batter into the prepared springform pan, smoothing the top.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/super-crumb-coffee-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the brown sugar and cinnamon to the reserved flour mixture. Toss with a fork until well blended. Sprinkle the crumbs over the batter, pressingly lightly so they stick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/super-crumb-coffee-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cake until the center is firm and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 45-55 minutes. Baking time varies, so begin checking at 45 minutes and don&#8217;t be alarmed if your cake takes longer. Mine usually takes the full 55 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/super-crumb-coffee-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool cake for 10 minutes before removing the sides of the springform pan. No changes. No substitutions \r\nThank you Sally!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sarita"}, "datePublished": "2022-05-06", "reviewBody": "A few tips: For those that had their topping sink into the cake, keep in mind making the 'course crumbs' here is a little different from pastry or biscuit dough. You don't want bits of butter floating around on their own - use your hand to gently mold the mixture so the butter is properly clumped with the sugar and cinnamon. \r\nI also STRONGLY recommend using cake strips or foil around the pan for this recipe. Because it's a dense batter but also doesn't have much fat, I have found it to be a little dry by the time I take it out. This time, I wrapped my cake strips around the pan and it was done by 45 minutes flat, if not earlier. The cake was soft and fluffy- even the edges! I realized later that I had completely forgotten the vanilla, but it was still delicious!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jamie"}, "datePublished": "2022-05-08", "reviewBody": "This recipe is so good! (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the eggs, sour cream, vanilla extract, and almond extract. Beat on medium-high speed until combined. The mixture may look curdled; that\u2019s ok. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, mix in the dry ingredients until smooth. Do not overmix. The batter will be thick. Carefully fold in the cherries and do not overmix. The batter will likely have streaks of pink; that&#8217;s ok. Spoon and spread into prepared pan. Add 3/4 cup (90g) confectioners&#8217; sugar and beat on low speed until sugar is incorporated, then turn the mixer up to medium-high speed and beat until combined and creamy. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Next, beat in the vanilla and peppermint extracts on medium-high speed until combined. Add the flour and salt and beat on low speed. The dough will look dry and you may not think the flour will fully combine. Once all of the flour is incorporated, turn the mixer up to high speed. The dough will come together. Finally, beat in the crushed candy canes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peppermint-snowball-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the cookie dough tightly and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes and up to 3 days. (If chilling for 3+ hours, make sure you let the cookie dough sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before rolling into balls. The cookie dough will be very stiff after being in the refrigerator for that long.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peppermint-snowball-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Place the cookies on wire racks to cool completely. The confectioners&#8217; sugar will melt a bit and get sticky. Once the cookies have completely cooled, roll in confectioners&#8217; sugar again. Topped with a sweet citrus icing, they stay soft for days and make a bright, melt-in-your-mouth winter treat.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "orange chocolate chip ricotta cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies-3-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies-3-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies-3-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies-3.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 3/4 cups (344g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed for shaping", "2 teaspoons baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon baking soda", "3/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 and 1/2 cups (300g) granulated sugar", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "10 ounces (283g) full-fat ricotta cheese, at room temperature (around 1 and 1/4 cups)", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons fresh orange zest", "1 Tablespoon (15g/ml) fresh orange juice", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 cup (180g) mini chocolate chips", "1 and 1/2 cups (180g) confectioners\u2019 sugar, sifted", "2-3 Tablespoons (30-45g/ml) fresh orange juice", "optional, for garnish: orange zest"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on medium-high speed until creamy, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. With the mixer running on low speed, add the eggs one at a time, then add the ricotta cheese, vanilla extract, orange zest, and orange juice. Beat on medium-high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the dry ingredients and the chocolate chips. Beat on low speed just until incorporated. Do not over-mix. Dough will be very creamy, sticky, and thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover dough tightly and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to 2\u20133 days. I prefer refrigerating overnight.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with\u00a0parchment paper\u00a0or\u00a0silicone baking mats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/orange-chocolate-chip-ricotta-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Scoop 1 scant Tablespoon of dough for each cookie (20-23g each), using the Tbsp measuring spoon and a lightly floured finger to nudge the dough onto the baking sheet. Lightly flour your finger again and reshape each portion into a ball. Get it nice and smooth, then add the sugar on medium speed until fluffy and light in color. Beat in egg, egg yolk, and vanilla. Scrape down the sides as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-sugar-cookie-bars/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cornstarch. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients in 3 different parts. The dough is quite thick. Once combined, gently fold in 1/2 cup sprinkles using a silicone spatula (or by mixing on low speed).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-sugar-cookie-bars/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Press the cookie dough evenly into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 25-26 minutes or until very lightly browned on top. You want the cookie bars to be extra soft, so careful not to overbake. Allow the bars to cool completely on a wire rack at room temperature before frosting. The center will slightly sink\u2014that&#8217;s normal.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-sugar-cookie-bars/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you don&#8217;t want a super thick layer of frosting as pictured, halve the frosting recipe. With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, cream, and vanilla extract with the mixer running on low. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. Add more confectioners&#8217; sugar if frosting is too thin or more cream if frosting is too thick. Add a pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. I usually add anywhere between 1/8 &#8211; 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Beat in food coloring, if using.", "name": "Make\u00a0the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/frosted-sugar-cookie-bars/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cooled bars from the baking pan using the aluminum foil overhang on the sides. Frost the bars with a thick layer of frosting and decorate with extra sprinkles if desired. Cut into squares. Use a very sharp knife and wipe off with a paper towel between each cut to make neat, even cuts. Mine are definitely not dry, and taste great. I underbaked them a bit (that's on me, I think I pulled them out a bit too soon and at the very low end of the bake time listed) but fortunately, I like a gooey bar. I did 3/4 recipe for the frosting and it was plenty for a 9x9 pan. I love frosting but the full recipe might even be a bit much for my taste. The bars poofed up quite a bit in the oven and sunk when pulled leaving a tall edge- something I don't personally mind, since everyone has preferences for edges, middles, and corners so it's best of all worlds. Read my recipe notes before beginning.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "cookies, icebox cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/neapolitan-cookies-4-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/neapolitan-cookies-4-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/neapolitan-cookies-4-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/neapolitan-cookies-4.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/neapolitan-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/2 cups (313g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/2 teaspoon baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "1 large egg + 1 egg yolk, at room temperature* (see note)", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "optional: 1 Tablespoon water and\u00a0coarse\u00a0sugar for sprinkling on top*", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons (12g)\u00a0all-purpose flour", "1 Tablespoon (20g)\u00a0strawberry jam", "1/2 teaspoon almond extract*", "pink or red food coloring*", "optional: 1/4 teaspoon strawberry extract for extra flavor*", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons (8g) unsweetened natural cocoa powder (or dutch process)", "1 ounce (28g)\u00a0semi-sweet chocolate, melted and slightly cooled"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk\u00a0the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl. Add the egg, egg yolk, and vanilla extract and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/neapolitan-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low until combined. Dough will be thick and sticky. Remove from the mixing bowl.\u00a0No need to rinse out the mixing bowl.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/neapolitan-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "There&#8217;s about 30 ounces of dough (1 lb, 14 ounces). Divide into three equal portions, about 10 ounces each. One portion is your vanilla dough. Nothing will be added to it. Set vanilla dough aside. For the pictured cookies, I only used 1 drop of dusty rose gel food coloring.\u00a0Remove from the mixing bowl.\u00a0No need to rinse out the mixing bowl.", "name": "Make the strawberry dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/neapolitan-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place last portion of dough back into the mixing bowl. Line a 9&#215;5-inch loaf pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to lift the chilled cookie dough out. I recommend layering the cookie dough into the pan in the following order: strawberry dough on the bottom, vanilla dough in the middle, chocolate dough on top. Using your hands, press each dough layer firmly and evenly into prepared loaf pan.", "name": "Shape and chill cookie dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/neapolitan-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover loaf pan tightly and chill dough in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours (and up to 4 days) or 1 hour in the freezer. You&#8217;ll have a 9&#215;5-inch block of dough. Slice in half lengthwise so you have two 2.5 x 9-inch rectangles. Use a sharp knife to trim off the ends so the rectangles are 8 inches long. Slice each into 16 cookies. Each cookie is 1/2 inch thick. Where I made my error with this recipe is I swapped out the amount plus the amount used in the almond exract, which I left out because I don't care for almond flavouring and I had read that another viewer did this with extract. Emulsion is more intense and doesn't bake off like extract can and I know this, but that's what I did and the strawberry was too much and left an aftertaste that I wasn't happy with so the whole batch went into the bin. I am kicking myself because I could have assessed this recipe better if I hadn't donee that. I also used Hershey's Special Dark cocoa powder, which is dutched and I am wondering if I would have gotten more flavour if I had used natural instead. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and then beat on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/inside-out-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt together until combined. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly pour into the wet ingredients. Beat on low until combined. The cookie dough will be quite thick. Switch to high speed and beat in the milk, then the white chocolate chips. The cookie dough will be sticky and tacky. Cover dough tightly and chill in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours and up to 3 days. Chilling is mandatory for this sticky cookie dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/inside-out-chocolate-chip-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator and allow to sit at room temperature for 10 minutes. (I like using this medium cookie scoop.) To ensure a thicker cookie, make the balls taller than they are wide (almost like a cylinder or column). Arrange 2-3 inches apart on the baking sheets. Grate the frozen butter using a box grater. Add it to the flour mixture and combine with a pastry cutter, two forks, or your fingers until the mixture comes together in pea-sized crumbs. See video and photo above for a closer look at the texture. Place in the refrigerator or freezer as you mix the wet ingredients together.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lavender-scones/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk 1/2 cup buttermilk, the egg, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. Dough will be sticky. If it&#8217;s too sticky, add a little more flour. If it seems too dry, add 1 more Tablespoon buttermilk. Press into an 8-inch disc and, with a sharp knife or bench scraper, cut into 8 wedges. For smaller scones, press dough into two 5-inch discs and cut each into 8 wedges. To make 10-12 drop scones: Keep mixing dough in the bowl until it comes together. Larger scones take closer to 25 minutes. (Tip: I like to start the icing while the scones cook so the milk has a chance to steep.) Remove from heat and immediately add the lavender. Set aside to steep for 15 minutes. Strain the milk through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl, then discard the lavender. Cool for 5 minutes. Whisk in the lemon juice and confectioners&#8217; sugar. Feel free to add more confectioners&#8217; sugar to thicken, if desired. Drizzle over warm scones. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg and vanilla extract, and then beat on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. In a separate bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt together. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly pour into the wet ingredients. Beat on low until combined. Switch to high speed and beat in the milk, then the chocolate chips.
